alert.note: Alert for Butler; Harvey; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 1:51AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Sedgwick, southeastern Harvey and southwestern Butler Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 151 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles west of Whitewater, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Newton, Andover, Augusta, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Rose Hill, North Newton, Douglass, Sedgwick, Towanda, Benton, Whitewater, Kechi, Eastborough, East Wichita, Northeast Wichita, Mcconnell Air Force Base and Newton Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 12 and 33. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 48 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for south central Kansas.
